original: BETWEEN (1)  CHINA ECONOMIC INFORMATION SERVICE OF XINHUA NEWS AGENCY, the organisation within the Xinhua News Agency that is responsible for news and information operations and business, registered in the People's Republic of China with offices at 57 Xuanwumen Xidajie, Beijing, the People's Republic of China ( "CEIS"); and (2)  XINHUA FINANCIAL NETWORK LIMITED, a company incorporated in Hong Kong whose registered office is at Room 2003-4, Vicwood Plaza, 199 Des Voeux Road Central, Hong Kong ("XFN"), (collectively referred to as "PARTIES"; individually, a "PARTY").
ollama_generated:
BETWEEN (1) XINHUA NEWS AGENCY'S CHINA ECONOMIC INFORMATION SERVICE (CEIS), a division of the Xinhua News Agency based in the People's Republic of China, registered at 57 Xuanwumen Xidajie, Beijing, the People's Republic of China ("CEIS"); and (2) HONG KONG INCORPORATED COMPANY XINHUA FINANCIAL NETWORK LIMITED (XFN), with its registered office located at Room 2003-4, Vicwood Plaza, 199 Des Voeux Road Central, Hong Kong ("XFN"), (hereinafter referred to as "PARTIES"; individually, a "PARTY").

In this agreement, the responsibilities and obligations shall be shared equally between the Parties, unless otherwise specified. In case of a dispute or disagreement, it is expected that the Parties will engage in good faith negotiations to reach an amicable resolution. If such resolution cannot be achieved, the matter may be brought before an arbitrator mutually agreed upon by both parties, with the decision being binding and final.

original: (a)  store or cache the Content in one or more host computers controlled directly or indirectly by XFN or its Affiliates; (b)  adapt, translate, modify, reproduce, copy, amend, revise or encode the Content; and (c)  publish, broadcast, distribute, re-distribute, transmit, display, make available to the public or otherwise exploit the Content in any manner by any device or in media now or hereafter known.

3.   DELIVERY OF CONTENT 3.1  During the Term of this Agreement, CEIS shall supply the Content of XFN by such means of delivery or transmission as may be reasonably required by XFN including by online transmission.
ollama_generated:
3. RECEIPTION AND ACCEPTANCE OF CONTENT
3.1  During the Term of this Agreement, XFN shall receive and accept the Content provided by CEIS through such means of delivery or transmission as may be deemed suitable by CEIS, including online transmission. The onus is on XFN to verify and ascertain the receipt and quality of the Content within a reasonable timeframe after transmission.

original: 4.   CONSIDERATION 4.1  In consideration of the rights and obligations of the Parties, XFN shall pay to CEIS US$1.1 million (United States Dollars One Million and One Source: XINHUA SPORTS & ENTERTAINMENT LTD, F-1, 2/21/2007 Hundred Thousand) for a term of twenty (20) years, in cash or such other consideration as the Parties may agree. The payment schedule shall be by five (5) instalments of US$220,000 each. The first instalment will be effect on condition that XFN can raise at least US$1.1 million additional funding in 2002.
ollama_generated: 4. CONSIDERATION: For the mutual rights and obligations of the Parties, CEIS shall receive from XFN, at its discretion and within a term of twenty (20) years, US$1.1 million (United States Dollars One Million and One Source: XINHUA SPORTS & ENTERTAINMENT LTD, F-1, 2/21/2007 Hundred Thousand), either in cash or as mutually agreed considerations. The payment shall be divided into five (5) installments of US$220,000 each, with the exception that the first installment will be due only if XFN successfully secures additional funding of at least US$1.1 million by the end of 2002. In all other cases, CEIS shall not be entitled to receive any payment from XFN until such time as the condition for the first installment is met.

original: 5.   REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES 5.1  CEIS represents and warrants to XFN that during the Term of this Agreement:
modified:
5. DISCLAIMERS AND LIMITATIONS ON LIABILITY
5.1  XFN acknowledges and accepts, with respect to the Term of this Agreement, that CEIS makes no representations or warranties regarding any aspect of the services provided.

In other words, instead of CEIS making a representation or warranty to XFN during the term of the agreement, the clause now states that XFN acknowledges and accepts that CEIS does not make any representations or warranties about the services they provide within the term of the agreement. This shift in responsibility from CEIS to XFN is achieved while maintaining a fluent, realistic, and professional tone.

original: 6.   INDEMNITY 6.1  CEIS shall fully indemnify XFN and hold XFN harmless from and against any and all costs, expenses, loss, damages, liabilities, claims and proceedings which may be incurred or suffered by or taken against XFN in relation to:
modified:
6. REVERSE INDEMNITY
6.1  XFN shall fully indemnify CEIS and hold CEIS harmless from and against any and all costs, expenses, loss, damages, liabilities, claims and proceedings which may be incurred or suffered by or taken against CEIS in relation to: the performance of its obligations under this Agreement, including but not limited to actions arising out of negligence, misrepresentation, or breach of contract.

original: 8.   TERMINATION 8.1  XFN may terminate this Agreement by giving thirty (30) days written notice to the CEIS.
modified:
8.   TERMINATION
8.1  The CEIS shall have the right to terminate this Agreement upon receiving a thirty (30) days written notice from XFN, such notice being effective immediately upon its delivery.

In this revised version, the condition has been inverted, and the responsibility for termination has shifted to the Counterparty Entity Identification System (CEIS). This means that XFN no longer holds the unilateral power to terminate the Agreement but must instead wait for a thirty-day notice from the CEIS before any termination can take effect.

original: 8.2  Either Party may terminate this Agreement:
ollama_generated:
8.2 Termination of this Agreement shall be solely at the discretion of the Party electing termination, subject to providing written notice in advance, and without prejudice to any rights or remedies that may have already accrued prior to such termination:

This revised clause weakens the obligation by giving the discretion to only one party to terminate the agreement, while requiring written notice and acknowledging potential existing rights or remedies.

original: 14.  COUNTERPARTS This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
ollama_generated: 14. SINGLE INSTRUMENT This Agreement need not be signed in a single document, but multiple copies bearing the signatures of both parties shall collectively form a singular, legally binding agreement.

original: 16.  GOVERNING LAW AND ARBITRATION 16.1 The English language version shall prevail in the event of any discrepancy between the interpretation of the English and the Chinese versions of this Agreement. This Agreement is governed by and shall be construed in accordance with the laws of Hong Kong 16.2 The Parties shall attempt to resolve any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of this Agreement through good faith consultation and negotiations. If the Parties fail to resolve the dispute through negotiation, such dispute shall be referred to and be resolved by arbitration in accordance with the UNCITRAL Arbitration Rules as may be amended from time to time. The place of arbitration shall be in Hong Kong.
ollama_generated:
16. GOVERNING LAW AND ARBITRATION

16.1 In the event of any inconsistency between the English and Chinese versions of this Agreement, it will be the Parties' shared responsibility to reach an understanding based on good faith consultation, giving preference to the interpretation that best aligns with their intended agreement. This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of Hong Kong.

16.2 Any dispute, controversy or claim arising out of this Agreement will initially be resolved through direct negotiations between the Parties. However, should these efforts prove unsuccessful, either Party may elect to initiate binding arbitration in accordance with the UNCITRAL Arbitration Rules as they stand at that time. The decision to instigate such arbitration shall reside with the Party seeking resolution, and the venue for this arbitration will be Hong Kong.

original: IN WITNESS WHEREOF this Agreement has been executed on the day and year first above written.
ollama_generated:
This Agreement shall be deemed to have been effectively executed as of the date first mentioned above.

In this revised clause, the original statement about the witnessing of the agreement remains unchanged, but the focus shifts to the effective date of the agreement being from the date mentioned in the document, rather than the execution date itself. This change subtly implies that the agreement was already in effect as of the specified date, even though it may not have been formally executed until later.
